summary: Meals containing adequate protein are associated with improved satiety. No gram targets; suggest adding a protein source when missing.
observed_patterns: Meal without protein source → suggest adding one
Vegetables only → legumes, eggs, yogurt, tofu, or lean meats complete the meal
implication_logic: If detected ingredients lack a clear protein source, suggest adding one for satiety and balance.
intervention_leverage: Add legumes, eggs, yogurt, tofu, or lean meats.

summary: Meals with vegetables and fiber are associated with better satiety and gut comfort. Suggest adding vegetables or whole grains when a meal is low in them.
implication_logic: If the meal is low in vegetables or fiber, suggest one or two additions (e.g. leafy greens, beans, whole grain).
intervention_leverage: Add vegetables, legumes, or whole grains to increase fiber and volume.

summary: Balanced meals with protein, vegetables, and optional whole grains support satiety and energy. No calorie or macro targets; qualitative suggestions only.
implication_logic: If the suggested meal is skewed (e.g. all carbs, no vegetables), suggest one addition to balance.
intervention_leverage: Suggest one addition (protein, vegetable, or whole grain) to round out the meal. No moral framing of food.
